reviews.review_title: One of the best Indian movies on military operations
reviews.content: I must say, I am delighted to see the cinematography, the screenplay and the visuals in this movie. Simply awesome!! On the story front, you have a atypical national revenge not often seen in Indian movies, with no fanfare, jingoism or hero-worship but more focused on the narrative with substantial realism. Sure, there were a few scenes where a hero might give up weapons to take on a villian one-on-one physically, but that's still excusable with the kind of direction & acting in this movie. The way they have depicted an army operation in this movie, tactical & precise with advanced combat weapons is quite a rarity in Indian movies. Yet, I am not a big fan of the story around and the depiction of the bird-like Drone which supposedly could operate for hours and made by an intern at DRDO. Not so much realistic as the rest of the movie was.No unwarranted romance, no over-the-top action both of which something Bollywood should try more of. Special appreciation for the background score in this movie, which is often noticed in Hollywood flicks with tense music and no unnecessary, inappropriate vocals on the top.Would love to see more like these movies, fictional or based on real events.

reviews.review_title: URI sets a bar for Indian action movies
reviews.content: URI was still playing in my little town in US so I wanted to know what's the hoopla around it. From get go, I was mesmerized by the cinematography of the movie especially the fire exchange scenes. Though the family drama dragged a bit but every actor delivered, even the little girl. Vicky Kaushal acting is at finest as many top Bollywood actors like Ranvir etc go over the top that I cringe to watch. I have not watched his body of work before but man, he was great. The fictitious elements like Garuda s and high level cover operation (Hollywood style) were very entertaining. Also, the movie unfolds in chapter format like cerebral western movies. Also action scenes are not ridiculously slow motion, an overused annoying treatment. Overall, it is very well-made movie that was very entertaining to watch. Not your typical masala action but more refined version of it.

One of the best patriotic movies ever made. The perspicuity by which the director presented the military tactics is an achievement in itself. The movie excels in capturing the emotions in the right quantity so not to make it mawkish.The only drawback of the film that I felt was the excessive and deliberate movement of the camera during fist fights to make it more effective and dramatic. The camera shaking was too much.

Never heard of this director but he sure has done a brilliant job showcase the precision of the Indian Army routine and techniques and training. Movies like should be make more often.
Looking forward for Aditya Dhar for future projects.
Vicky and Mohit sure is a good pair.
Awesome movie and awesome acting by Vicky Kaushal, Yamini and other members

I usually don't write reviews. I am writing this because I feel like this whole review has been a misrepresentation either because it is influenced or it is coming from the population that will click 10 stars in the name of pretentious pride and masochistic heroism.
Let's keep the topic aside for a minute, judging it purely from the stand point of a film:
Storyline: Was so weakly depicted. There is obviously a withering old lady that the man has to take care of, who suddenly like bad bollywood films remembers his name inspite of a worsening and apparently "aggressively spreading" Alzheimer's, you know because it is the end of the movie. The nurse obviously had to be pretty one so that he could fall in love with her. Though he previously indicated that he probably had a crush on this colleague, which conveniently got dropped when he found out that she is a widow. Then of course there is a side show brother in law or brother who from the beginning you know is only there to be killed heroically when his wife is the most pregnant (because obviously) so that the actual hero can use it as a core feeling for revenge based irrational decisions which for some reason is all ignored because why not. Then there is this intern who is so amazing that after a fun but somehow perfectly working brilliant prototype, he suddenly single handedly manages a big part of the mission because you know interns are so fully equipped to handle wars.Cinematography: So shabby. They tried poorly to replicate some of the inspired hand held camera work, but they probably didn't know when to stop. You could perfectly tell at every minute what kind of equipment they were using at a particular shot and what kind of disasters were happening behind the scenes because some of it was clearly visible. The editing was clearly done in short notice possibly to get it released on time before the voting.Dialogue were severely sub par and predictable. They used brilliant actors and reduced them to no-brain black and white characters with no dept to narrate a really shoddily written script.Negative implications: The movie represents how it is suddenly good for us to become irrational assholes torturously murdering people because who cares for strategies when all we want is "their head". Undoubtedly the testosterone clad audience was laughing and cheering when the hero was vividly slashing the throat for the last terrorist (for the drama of course) and he screams "Indian Army".

reviews.review_title: Best war movie made in India
reviews.content: If you ignore the politics, this is the most well made war film technically.

Starting with the Background scores and songs were good. An electronic music that bursts your adrenaline during the action scenes. No unnecessary songs were used in the movie and the album is over-average.
The VFX used were amazing. I believed each and every chopper used in the movie was real. The CGI of drone looked so real too. As the movie was of war-drama genre, I didnt expect a lot of good movie shots of Kashmir but that wasn't the case here. Drone shots did capture some good areas. This movie didnt go for impossible stunts that is highly make-believe. Stunts on pars, with a lot of Army Level skills by performing artists.
The movie has some great dialogues. Vicky Kaushal probably had 20-30 dialogues throughout the movie but all of them just hits with a Bang. Aditya Dhar did an amazing job with the Storyline and Dialogue Delivery of each and every character - Vicky Kaushal, Yami Gautam, Paresh Rawal, Mohit Raina, Rajit Kapur, Kirti Kulhari etc was well timed and used only when necessary.
The delivery of the movie was in Novel format. Stories were short as well as long when neccessary. The movie did not have unnecesaary links just to crisp up the movie. Some sections of the movie did give goosebumps. Hence the ratings given.

reviews.review_title: Great Tribute to Indian Surgical Strike on Terrorism With a Lackluster Addition of Typical "Bollywood Fiction"
reviews.content:
Summary: A must watch for every Human being belonging to any race, religion, caste or gender.Plot: The plot is a mixture of life of Major Vihan and his commandos leading upto the shameful attack on URI district by terrorists attacking and killing 19 soldiers in their sleep till the first half, the second half is dedicated to planning and execution of the URI surgical strike by the Indian army commandos lead by Major Vihan.Script/Screenplay/Dialogue: The overall script is very mixed, while there are parts which are highly realistic and close to ground, there are also parts of typical bolllywood massala (mostly the additional fiction). These fictional additions are not really breaking the nature or mood of the film, they are very basic and typically seen in any bollywood movie, although the writes/directors could have done a much better job if they instead added the fiction which could be more fitting in the film.Here I will list the absurd parts, no spoilers just the names, so you will realize them as you are watching the movie.
1. Secret Agent becoming terrorist interrogator, 2. Agent not telling about GPS for no reason until the end to ummm... show attitude?, 3. Garud drone from random kid, 4. Buildup being shown as Chapters, 5. Security officer breaking phones after each call, 6. The recruit commandos somehow already know how to respond to Major Vihan's Punch line. etc.Screenplay: Screenplay is extremely strong until the final strike, the emotions, the feel, the tension everything is spot on, and that's why the film is extremely enjoyable and satisfying. The small problem I have is that I was expecting to see some scenes showcasing the other 3 groups in which all the commandos were split, but only Major Vihan's group's strike was shown on screen. But overall everything you watch on screen will be very accurate and ensure the flow of all kinds of emotion in every moment.Dialogue: The dialogue in this movie nothing over the top, and that's a good thing. All dialogues perfectly fit in the scenario and there are a couple of quote worthy one's too, including Major Vihan's punch line, Major Karan's daughter's War Cry (extremely emotional), etc.Acting/Performance by Artists: Every single actor and actress has performed very good in the movie, EXCEPT (well you had it coming) Yami Gautam.
To be honest, Yami's character is a complete fill in, there is no single need of that character at all, literally. Her character is totally forgettable and does nothing to add to the story. Talking about her performance, well I don't know what is with the female artists in bollywood, specially the bigger names, they are all cast for their cute faces, and the fanbase that they'll bring to the cinemas. Her performance is extremely pathetic, she is completely overshadowed by Kirti Kulhari's performance as Seerat Kaur. Just watching the interrogation scene will make you realize how bad Yami is, and that her character overall accomplishes nothing. An extreme fill in with no purpose to the story.
On the other hand, Vicky, Rohit, Paresh and the others do very good job as their characters.Music/Songs/Mood: 100% spot on as required, no complains here. Although I will mention that during initial credits scene the music that is used way too high energy to begin with, so the pace kicks off right from the start.Vfx/Budget/Hardware: The specifications are not released to the public, so I cannot comment on that, the budget was estimated around 60-65 million $ and I think it does a fairly good job of using that budget to create a good overall cinematic experience.Genre and it's justification: The Genre is action/war and honestly speaking, movie has a lot of realistic action and army grade gore, ofcourse this movie is not for kids in anyway, there is blood and gore in the movie which is obvious for this genre. Genre is completely justified, except for the added bollywood style fiction.Conclusion and Should You watch it in a Theater?: This is a bollywood movie I have loved in a long time, and you should definitely watch this in a theater as soon as you can.My ratings : 7/10
Reducing 3 three stars from three reasons.
1. Screenplay didn't involve the 3 other groups.
2. Yami Gautam.
3. Massala Fiction.
Mustn't add the tag 'inspired by a true story'. A true story should be made a little practical. Some scenes seemed to be comical.

reviews.review_title: How's the josh? HIGH SIR! - Excellent

Movie is not only about surgical strike it is about emotions and sentimental of every Indian who loves Indian forces very much. There are many dramatic scenes also those make move interesting and entraining.Direction:-
Aditya Dhar is director&writer of the movie. "URI: The Surgical Strike" is his debut movie and he is just like "Fata Poster Nikala Hero" with his direction fo URI. Movie gets emotions, patriotism, a bit drama with entertainment under Aditya direction. Surgical strike scene are very much well directed, you can feel that you are watching a live surgical strike. I want to say WELL DONE !Acting:-
Vicky Kausal is in main lead role and did a fabulous job, there is no doubt that after this movie Vikcy Kausal will be in the list of top Bollywood new comers. He seems exact like a army man in movie. Mahdev Tv serial actor Mohit Rain is coming first time on big screen and he proved his acting skills despite role is small. All other actors(Paresh Raval, Yami Gautam, Pink actress Kirti Kulhari etc. ) also did justice with their characters.Music:-
2 songs one is Challa and other is Jagga Jiteya out of 5, are enough powerful to give you goosbumps. Background music also very much powerful and its timing on scenes is very much perfect.Vfx and Cinematography:-
So much clarity in vfx. War scenes are awesome, this movie achieved a next level in India if we talk about war vfx scenes. Cinematography is also fabulous specially in night scenes.Summary:-
(8/10)

reviews.review_title: How's the Josh ? High, Sir. Same goes for the movie.
reviews.content:
Short and honest review here.
Story - Not completely real but dramatised a bit and in places you feel the Bollywood masala touch(2-3 scenes max). But overall a good storyline and a proper chronological order of narration helps in keeping the 'josh' high throughout the movie.
Cinematography - Brilliant. Simply well done.
Acting - Vicky Kaushal plays his part with perfection. Others are also good. But Vicky simply steals the show.
Soundtrack - Amplifies the emotions in the film. Most of the adrenaline rush(more than a few goosebumps moment are there) in this film is owed to the soundtrack.
All said this movie surely is entertaining as well as brings out the patriot in you. But don't go to the theatre expecting a documentary-type film with full fledged facts about the strike for it is not one.

reviews.review_title: A must watch for Vicky kaushals performance
reviews.content:
The film is a must watch for the Vicky Kaushal acting and Paresh Rawal as a NDA. The film's opens up in chapter and giving us a countdown till the surgical strike. Each chapter progress the story forward and many of the scenarios are covered as in real world missions always do not go as planned as opposed to some movies where everything is in place and mission goes smoothly.
Director Aditya Dhar make the movie as a no nonsense movie with no song or love story crawling in between. The DOP has done a great job with audience are put right in the middle of action and every scene is simple to follow even though the film covers the scene from different angles. The background score keeps you intrigued and on the edge of the seat. The song challa is also used to progress the story and does not feel like it hinders with it in any way.
Kirti kulhari has a very small role, Yami Gautam look carries her character of intelligence persona effortlessly. Mohit raina makes a debut in this movie from small screen and is a good addition to the cast. I only regret that he would have gotten more screen time. Rajit kapur carries the role of "PM" but other than the facial look nothing works to look like the actual person. Paresh Rawal does a great job as NDA and is like a internal director in the movie. Nothing less would be expected from him.
Last but not the least Vicky Kaushal is the new actor. Being his first solo movie he just outshines -he is the core of this movie. Strong but vulnerable in his own sense. He carries the burden of the family but is always prepared for the service of the nation. In one scene he is standing with his eyes wet but with a crisp uniform giving a tribute to a soldier and the pause at the end is a masterstroke. the army avatar is flawless and we clearly sees the effort put in. The warcry "how's the Josh" fills not only the onscreen cast but the audience with patriotism. Though Vickys last scene is where you might see the fiction crawling in though the film clearly states based on fact but it's been fictionalized.
Hands down the best performance by Vicky and a must watch movie

reviews.review_title: An outstanding movie based on our emotion.
reviews.content:
I strongly followed when in 2015 India first avenged the atrocities done by NSCN-k when they attacked the Indian army regiment in Manipur and then our special paramilitary force retaliated with heavy gunfire through surgical strike. But i never thought Indian army will do similar activity in J & K. It's one of the proudest moment as an Indian that we have to witness ever.
Now comes the movie. It's i believe 90% similar to the real event that happened in URI Kashmir on 2016. I believe Some details were kept in the shadow for national security reason and I totally accept it. Vicky Kaushal has poured 200% from his side and each n every one of them are just phenomenal. But true hero is the story telling and the action sequences. Its not common in India to have such vivid description on something so spectacular. I congratulate each n every member of the URI team for the success. Just a hint today morning show I have watched it. Almost after whole month of the movie got released and the theatre is almost 60% full.
Great job done guys 10/10 for such an initiative and a must watch for every Indian. Jai hind. 🇮🇳🇮🇳

reviews.review_title: Only one issue... Why don't we make more "remarkable" movies like this one!
reviews.content: This is one epic masterpiece... If i could just describe in one line. However even that won't be enough! A truly remarkable, no nonsense, high quality, absolutely breathtaking cinema... For once i had to pinch myself that was i actually watching an Indian Bollywood movie or was it a work of art by some top international film maker? Everything about this movie is perfect... Acting, story, direction, action, emotions and that amazing patriotic feeling! Guess we are entering into the new world of beautiful high quality cinema, which gets appreciated by it's audience too instead of those stupid brain dead terrible so called commercial khan movies with no seance or track and still end up doing crores of business.URI is a celebration of the best our Indian cinema can be and silently has set a benchmark without even trying to do so... Only time will tell if another movie can surpass it in future.... But for now, i can say this without a doubt that it is one of the best movie made in India... Period!
No story, no theme, just hypothetical thinking. This could have been better with any other actor.

reviews.review_title: Enigmatic, stupendous, exhilarating & most importantly patriotic cinematic envision
reviews.content:
I must agree that after Border & Lakshya, this is the most engrossing & exhilarating movie made on Indian Army. Movie based on retaliation operation carried out by Indian Army better known as Surgical strike, as an solid answer to the shamefull attack by Pakistan on Uri base camp in which Indian Army's 19 soldiers were martyred & over 80 injured. Movie shows how badass Indian army is when it comes to defending our nation. Whole movie is just so emotionally charged up & you are constantly kept on edge of the seat till the end. Vicky Kaushal as Major Vihaan Singh Shergill is in my opinion the most badass potrayal of an Indian Soldier till date. Vicky Kaushal is a treat to watch & you can experience as to how he has grown as an actor. Mohit Raina as Major Karan Kashyap is a worth mentioning as it's his debut appearance on big screen. Yami Gautam as RAW agent is badass & crisp. Paresh Rawal is as usual excellent as Govind or you can say Ajit Doval. Special mention to Rajit Kapoor for enacting our PM NAMO.
The movie is worth watch & too emotional. Movie potrays life of an Indian Soldier to its reality. Highly recommended to all the patriots of India.

reviews.review_title: "Uri: The Surgical strike"- A fitting tribute to the Indian army.
reviews.content: URI The Surgical Strike is the Best and Smartest War Movie ever made in our country. Practically and Strictly made for urban audiences, this film marks a historical turn around for Indian film making.. Those frequent Hand-held Camera Movements, those never before seen Visual effects with long range Sniper Attacks or tactically placing Drones and above all, no unnecessary Emotional Drama but Superfast-paced Cold Blooded and Gripping War flick..!!I would say two names - Vicky Kaushal who will surely find his Stardom with this one and Aditya Dhar, the Debutant Director is a volcano of talent and his homework and research reflected totally on Silver-Screen..!! Salute to you..!!And Lastly, I don't know how much the story is exaggerated or dramatized but one thing I would tell for sure that Indian Film-making's future is in safe hands and they will march ahead with their head held high far and far away..!!!My Rating is 10/10 and only rating was cut cause I wanted a bit more from the supporting characters as this film was almost a One Man Show - Vicky Kaushal..!!!!

reviews.review_title: Even after 24 hours i am still speachless!!!
reviews.content: After a bunch of non-sense movies i have made a rule for myslef to never spend a dime again on any Bollywood movie in theater. Don't take me wrong i do like hindi movies like Stree, Andhadhoon last year but i sitll think those can be watched on small screen at the comfort of my home. The lack of grandure and complelling cinematography in Indian movies just does not warrent a theatrical experience.But for URI i made an exception and boy was i so happy to be wrong. From start to finish this took me on ride of all kinds of emotion. One moment i was angry and the other moment i was crying and the very next moment i just terified. Man its a been a long time since a movie actully made me cry, but when the little girl screamed the war cry in front of her father's photo; tears started to roll down from my eyes.From start to finish this kept me glued to the screen and invested in Vickey's character. The direction and acting is so daam good, i forgot i was watching a bollywood movie. The VFX team of Thugs of Hindustan should be interning at these guys' company. reviews.review_title: URI movie reviews are given below
reviews.content:
Aditya Dhar's unforgiving war drama incorporates the events that led to the surgical strikes as seen through the eyes of protagonist Major Vihaan Singh Shergill (Vicky Kaushal). To make things harder for him, he has personal battles to fight at home as well.
First things first, Vicky Kaushal is on a roll. Interestingly, after playing a valiant Pakistani Army officer in Raazi, here he switches sides and plays an invincible Para (Special Forces) Commando, Indian Army. Justifying the hype around him, the actor continues to grow from strength to strength.
The film scores higher on the technical front than creative. The combat sequences, ambush, gunfire, fistfights, sniper shots are realistically shot.
Though based on true events, a lot seems far-fetched and thus, questionable. One can overlook a few creative liberties, but there is deliberate and dramatic attempt to evoke emotions in the first half. While there is no harm in doing so, the emotional manipulation could have been more subtle and less predictable. Yami Gautam, Mohit Raina, Paresh Rawal and Kirti Kulhari are effective in their respective roles.
The soldiers give up their today for our tomorrow and no words can signify or repay the sacrifices they make for our country. Uri puts a spotlight on the thankless job they do with passion in their hearts and fire in their bellies. The film is a fitting tribute to the Indian Army conceptually but cinematically, it's not a film without flaws.

Alright people, I am spreading the words out now - URI - The Surgical Strike is the Best and Smartest War Movie ever made in our country. Practically and Strictly made for urban audiences, this film marks a historical turn around for Indian film making.. Those frequent Hand-held Camera Movements, those never before seen Visual effects with long range Sniper Attacks or tactically placing Drones and above all, no unnecessary Emotional Drama but Superfast-paced Cold Blooded and Gripping War flick..!!
I would say two names - Vicky Kaushal who will surely find his Stardom with this one and Aditya Dhar, the Debutant Director is a volcano of talent and his homework and research reflected totally on Silver-Screen..!! Salute to you..!!
And Lastly, I don't know how much the story is exaggerated or dramatized but one thing I would tell for sure that Indian Film-making's future is in safe hands and they will march ahead with their head held high far and far away..!!!
My Rating is 10/10 and only rating was cut cause I wanted a bit more from the supporting characters as this film was almost a One Man Show - Vicky Kaushal..!!!!
This is a Bollywood movie this is what Bollywood. An amazing masterpiece. Such a great cinematography and direction.

reviews.review_title: The film is a fitting tribute to the Indian Army
reviews.content:
This unforgiving war drama incorporates the events that led to the surgical strikes as seen through the eyes of protagonist Major Vihaan Singh Shergill (Vicky Kaushal here).
First things first, Vicky Kaushal is on a roll of an invincible Para Commando, Indian Army. His sincere and effortless presence adds depth to this film, that otherwise lacks the palpable tension you expect from a war drama. What makes it then engaging is not its execution, but the audacity of the mission it dramatically decodes and recreates. Despite knowing the result, you watch the events unfold with childlike intrigue as the complex operation plan was classified.The film scores higher on the technical front than creative. The combat sequences, ambush, gunfire, fistfights, sniper shots are realistically shot. The camera tactfully follows the soldiers like a shadow. Sound effects are crucial to combat film storytelling, and this war drama uses it effectively for most parts. The sounds of weapons and bullets are captured well but some unnecessary sounds (loud whispers, noisy footsteps) beat the very purpose of a covert mission.

reviews.review_title: Impressive. Film making is good. Looks like oiginal Surgical Strike
reviews.content:
The film is based on the surgical strikes conducted in 2016 by the Indian Army, against militant launch pads in Pakistan occupied Kashmir (PoK). Many terrorists were reportedly killed in the covert operation, in retaliation to the terrorist attack in Uri that killed 19 Indian soldiers.
The film begins with a surgical strike being conducted by special force commandos led by Major Vihaan Shergill (Vicky Kaushal) against North-East insurgents hiding in Myanmar. Vihaan wants to leave the army on compassionate grounds as his mother is suffering from an advanced stage of Alzheimer's. He's transferred to Delhi so he can be with his mother. His brother-in-law Karan (Mohit Raina), a fellow major in the army gets killed when Pakistan based terrorists strike Uri. A devastated Vihaan asks permission to lead a counter-strike across the border. How he goes about it forms the crux of the film.
The film scores higher on the technical front than creative. The combat sequences, ambush, gunfire, fistfights, sniper shots are realistically shot. The camera tactfully follows the soldiers like a shadow. Sound effects are crucial to combat film storytelling, and this war drama uses it effectively for most parts. The sounds of weapons and bullets are captured well but some unnecessary sounds (loud whispers, noisy footsteps) beat the very purpose of a covert mission.
Usually, these kinds of movies are adulterated by adding useless things but this movie kept to the point and delivered something great.

One thing that I really noticed is the sound mixing, particularly in the scenes, where not only one can hear the guns firing, but you actually hear the sound of bullet shells dropping as well. URI : The Surgical Strike is the story of the 2016 surgical strike conducted by the Indian army against suspected militants in Pakistan occupied Kashmir.
Written and directed by Aditya Dhar, it has been shot in cinéma vérité style à la Zero Dark Thirty and stars Vicky Kaushal, Paresh Rawal, Rajit Kapoor, Mohit Raina, Yami Gautam, Kirti Kulhari among others.
The story begins with the attack in URI, and focuses on the work done on the ground by the government, army and intelligence operatives that led to the counter attack.
Kaushal looks the part and is very believable as Major Vihaan. Mohit Raina also commands a striking presence as Major Karan, but other characters could have been developed better.
While the story is executed well, it is sprinkled with a few bollywood cliches, which could have been avoided.
The army backdrop looks authentic, the direction is crisp, the cinematography is great and there are moments when you feel 'you are there'.
I experienced it, and you probably will too, the crowd clapped and whistled through the movie. Overall, while it's not without its flaws, URI is a good one-time watch.

reviews.review_title: Perfect depiction of real Surgical strike. A superb masterpiece.
reviews.content:
Operational difficulties like maintaining secrecy to surveillance of enemy territory to training to final execution is completely apt. Vicky Kaushal excels as a strike team commander. Mohit Raina is class apart as a paracommando and outclasses all the current bollywood actors in terms of a soldier personality. And for the viewers who may not know that apart from the surgical strike shown in the movie of 29th Sep, 2016 on POK, there have been many other surgical strikes like :-> Operation Ginger. Also known as bloodiest year of 2011 to 2012 on LOC.
-> In 2002 when Operation Parakram was at its peak and heavy pounding from enemy artillery across LOC was stopped by surgical strike by Indian Airforce with laser guided targets.
-> Capturing of peak 5310 also known as "Reverse Kargil". Indian army captured the point under commanding officer (Now retired) Lt. General H S Panag.These are some of the many undertaken by Special Group/ Paracommandos and JKP SOG over past 3 decades. So this movie is a very very rich tribute to our gallant armed soldiers who can do the things unimaginable with surgical precision. It will remain as a benchmark of how a film on operations should be made.

His isn't a typical bollywood film filled with unnecessary songs, dances, romances or titillating bodies. No.This is a straight forward "zero dark thirty"-esque no-nonsense plot driven gritty war thriller.The actors are all great but Vicky Kaushal easily stands out amongst them all.The production value can give Hollywood films a run for their money.At times it tends to be slightly jingoistic but thankfully those times pass by soon. Majority of the film takes a realistic approach to the surgical strike events.Also, contrary to beliefs, this film doesn't show any country or religion in bad light, just terrorists hiding in a neighbouring country.A great watch overall. Full paisa vasool.

reviews.review_title: A fitting tribute to the indian army. Must watch
reviews.content: Based on true events the success of this film goes down to the vision of debutante director aditya dhar and the honest efforts put by the caste. The movie ticks most of the boxes right. The movie is divided into chapters and does a very good job in building up towards the strike. Vicky kaushal's character has a lot of heavy lifting and he makes us buy those things. The direction of the action sequences is carried out with great conviction and aditya dhar makes us buy those things easily. There's not a moment when we lose interest in the film. It keeps us to the edge of our seats till the very end. Each and every member of the caste has done a really good job and have done justice to their chara ters. There is a thin like between patriotism and jingoism and thankfully the movie doesn't cross this line and touches every patriotic chord of your body. A huge shoutout to mohit raina who does a really good job in portraying hos character and does his part with confidence. But the movie has its flaws there are two moments when the lead gets into a hand to hand combat with terrorists out of these the first combat was clearly avoidable and was a bit cliche. Also initially the movie goes a bit slow but it recovers it's pace and then keeps you hooked. It also makes us realise the emotional trauma that families of our brave soldiers go through. All in all its a great movie which makes every indian proud of indian army. It's a great love letter to the indian army. Not only this also makes me proud that his kind of technical film is finally being made in indiaPlease let me know how you felt my review. This was my first review so please let me know how can I improve

reviews.review_title: One of the Smartest Storytelling in Bollywood Movie History!! 9.5/10
reviews.content:
Before I review this title let me tell a thing or two about me. I rarely watch Bollywood movies in theaters. Last few movies I watched in theater are Dangaal, Neerja, Airlift, Toilet, Padman and watched first few seconds of Race3 trailer on YouTube, closed it and never bothered about it.
While talking about this movie, it is thrilling, well paced, no excess drama, just straight forward great story telling. In one word it is just "Awesome". You will feel the flow of emotions in the theater during the tragic scenes and the excitement when there is action and they have plenty of it. This is a really good homage for our armed forces, who sacrifices a lot protecting our borders. Some reviewers have criticized Rajit Kapoor saying that he did not fit as Narendra Modi ji, which is somewhat true. But if you look at him playing his part as a sincere Prime Minister, he also did a great job. Acting does not mean mimicking all the time.
Where this movie could have improved, by showing some actions from other teams as well during Surgical Strike. It is 9.5/10 from me.

reviews.review_title: Film Review URI The Surgical Strike Review By Suvendu Mandal # MAR (MAKAUT)
reviews.content:
Aswsome & Energetic Film.
Alright Folks, I am spreading the words out now - URI - The Surgical Strike is the Best and Smartest War Movie ever made in our country. Practically and Strictly made for urban audiences, this film marks a historical turn around for Indian film making.. Those frequent Hand-held Camera Movements, those never before seen Visual effects with long range Sniper Attacks or tactically placing Drones and above all, no unnecessary Emotional Drama but Superfast-paced Cold Blooded and Gripping War flick..!
I would say two names - Vicky Kaushal who will surely find his Stardom with this one and Aditya Dhar, the Debutant Director is a volcano of talent and his homework and research reflected totally on Silver-Screen..!! Salute to you..!!
And Lastly, I don't know how much the story is exaggerated or dramatized but one thing I would tell for sure that Indian Film-making's future is in safe hands and they will march ahead with their head held high far and far away..!!!
My Rating is 10/10 and only rating was cut cause I wanted a bit more from the supporting characters as this film was almost a One Man Show - Vicky Kaushal..!!!!

The movie is soo realistic.Excellent acting with maintaining real facts ,especially by Vicky Kaushal. The VFX effects were awesome also. After a long period of time i have watched a patriotic movie with realistic facts. The storyline was so amazing. Kudos to all workers added with this movie. This kind of movie makes my country proud. i will recommend my friends and family to watch this movie. This movie is really one of the masterpieces in bollywood. Each time, Vicky Kaushal's Vihaan screams, 'How's the Josh?' to his battalion of soldiers, you feel the adrenaline rush as you hear, 'Very high, Sir.' It increases patriotism in every indian. All must should watch this movie. I was waiting for realise of this movie since the time i saw it's teaser.Overall a great movie with a great performances. kudos to everyone who connected to this movie. An amazing lifetime experience .

The scenes in this movie are deadly realistic. Best movie ever seen by me. Indian Army- The Best..

ATANTIKA SAHA
DATE- 9.06.2021
MOVIE NAME- Uri: The Surgical Strike
Uri movie cast: Vicky Kaushal, Mohit Raina, Paresh Rawal, Rajit Kapoor, Yami Gautam, Kirti Kulhari, Swaroop Sampat
Uri movie director: Aditya Dhar
RELEASE DATE- 11 January,2019 .Story: The film is based on the surgical strikes conducted in 2016 by the Indian Army, against militant launch pads in Pakistan occupied Kashmir (PoK). Vicky plays the role of a dedicated soldier, Vihaan, who is known for his meticulous strategising and planning in missions. After a successful mission, he wishes to retire from army life, as his mother needs him.Review: Aditya Dhar's unforgiving war drama incorporates the events that led to the surgical strikes as seen through the eyes of protagonist Major Vihaan Singh Shergill (Vicky Kaushal). The storyline isn't entirely unpredictable; we know what will push Vihaan to take up the mission of the surgical strikes against the terrorists.The second half focuses on the Indian Army planning the attack against the militants. The tone of the film hits a crescendo as India gets ready to teach Pakistan a lesson in bloodshed and violence. Vihaan shouts, "They want Kashmir and we want their heads!" The soldiers holler back in agreement. The combat sequences, ambush, gunfire, fistfights, sniper shots are realistically shot. The camera tactfully follows the soldiers like a shadow. Sound effects are crucial to combat film storytelling, and this war drama uses it effectively for most parts.In the film, there is a stark difference between the intelligence meetings in Pakistan as compared to those taking place in India. The officials in the neighbouring country constantly put down India at any chance they get. Pakistani officials are boorish, with some burp-induced humour and are shown willing to drink themselves silly, whereas the Indians are constantly alert and on their toes.Uri: The Surgical Strike is clear from the word go as to which political party it caters to, and makes no secret of it. Modi and National Security Advisor Ajit Doval (Rawal) is seen in practically every scene and is part of every meeting that involves discussions on the surgical strikes. The timing of this film couldn't have been more perfect.The soldiers give up their today for our tomorrow and no words can signify or repay the sacrifices they make for our country. Uri puts a spotlight on the thankless job they do with passion in their hearts and fire in their bellies.The soldiers give up their today for our tomorrow and no words can signify or repay the sacrifices they make for our country. Uri puts a spotlight on the thankless job they do with passion in their hearts and fire in their bellies.#MARACTIVITY
#FILMREVIEW.

reviews.review_title: Taut-thriller that checks all boxes for a thriller
reviews.content: Uri: The Surgical Strikes is a taut thriller based on the real surgical strikes against terror camps based in Pakistan-Occupied-Kashmir.It is technically superior to almost any other Indian war movie made to date (Parmanu & Madras Cafe weren't strictly war movies). Some creative liberties have been taken, as is to be expected in a movie, and the action could have been better choreographed - though some of the hand-to-hand combat is superbly donw - but overall the fighting scenes take you right in the middle.Movies like these are much-needed. It doesn't rationalize, doesn't sympathize with terrorism or terrorists. Is not apologetic about our soldiers. Celebrates their incredible bravery.Is it a propaganda movie? No. It would have become that much less effective had it tried to be a propaganda movie. Among real-life figures, it is Doval (played by Paresh Rawal) that the movie highlights rather than Modi. Your children need to, must, see the movie. A couple of scenes may be graphic, but no more than what kids are already exposed to. And yes, I guarantee you that there won't be a dry eye in the theater at one point.Vicky Kaushal is excellent. Paresh Rawal nails it as the NSA, Ajit Doval. Rajit Kapoor plays Modi in very subdued shades, which actually work, since that keeps the focus on the action. Mohit Raina is terrific. Yami Gautam is there for the glamour Q. Swaroop Sampat is poignant. Rakesh Bedi is brilliant in a short cameo. And the little girl will break your heart.To conclude, in the 40 or so years that I have memories of watching movies in theaters, this is the first time - EVER - that cries of "Jai Hind" & spontaneous applause rend the hall.
One of the best movies so far. Hip hip hurray!!! I love the way movie deals with the valor of our beloved armed forces.

The film writers should have done a little more research with regards to the setting and costumes. The acting of the lead cast is pretty good and the basic premise of the story seems OK. The main problem I have with the film is the unrealistic storyline. 1) In reality, the actual operation was carried out during dawn and there were no choppers involved. 2) Night vision goggles don't glow in the dark 3) Quarter zip combat shirt isn't introduced in 2016 4) gear looks way too advanced and a little over exaggerated 5) main protagonist able to withstand grenade explosions mere meters away all for that cliché "walking away from explosion" shot 6) the main protagonist ditching his gear and assault rifle to combat the terrorist hand to hand so that it pleases indian crowds as usual 7) in special forces, laser sight is usually infrared as it is not visible to the naked eye, unless you have your night vision goggles down. 8) major vihan just can't ask for a pilot, don't get me started on the ridiculous air to ground heli sequence when the team was trying to return.I feel that the makers could have studied the operation a little more and portray a very accurate account of what really happened. But I guess its all about pleasing the Indian audience because of their short attention span with hand to hand combat scenes and other illogical sub-plots with the revenue in mind. Overall, there were some good moments and it is a film that has some good intention. Could have done much better though.

reviews.review_title: Vicky Kaushal starrer, 'Uri - The Surgical Strike' hit the theatres today. It is a movie said to be based on true events, Indian Army's surgical strikes on Pakistan Administer
reviews.content: Vicky Kaushal, who had a golden year in 2018, starts 2019 with a bang. There are no complaints about his acting, though at points you want to see more of Vicky's acting than his action. Vicky does his best and works hard to push the film forward. Kirti Kulhari, who made quite an impact with the film Pink, is sadly wasted here as the pilot of Vicky's helicopter, who is just eager to prove, in her own words, her "desh-bhakti". Yami Gautam gives a fair performance but recedes into the background quite often.
Based on a true event, highly gripping, intense and great cinematography acting was above the notch every scene is performed with high intensity after all a very high Josh performance

URI : THE SURGICAL STRIKE (2019) (Hindi - U) Written & Directed by Aditya Dhar, this war thriller 'Based on True Events' pulls the string of being Proud to be guarded by Indian Army, rather getting pumped patriotic. the movie stars Vicky Kaushal (Major Vihaan Singh Shergill), Paresh Rawal (Govind), Mohit Raina (Major Karan Kashyap) with others. Aditya has spread the movie in chapters, an intelligent method to set a premise for the big story, when the crux is predictable - people already know the climax, so how different is the presentation ? Matters a lot, Aditya has hit that chord, taking you on a high ride from the first chapter - attack n retaliation from extremists; emotional fulcrum of Vihaan n his mother; Vihaan with his Brother - in - law Karan; the attack and the final chapter of the covert operation to avenge Indian Soldiers during very early hours, when they were unarmed, the strategy used, planning, special forces training are the peak dots that would shrill your thoughts, Music by Shashwat Sachdev covers the whole movie with a tense tone, n low thumping rock; it worked. Mitesh Mirchindani whelmed the lenses, Indo-Pak border areas, Delhi Home, training fields with regiment, and the dense forest scenes of Serbia are captured with an eye to detail; blue hue tone mostly in woods, the pale yellow tone during the avenge attack, stay close to your connect with the happening. Action Director Stefan Richter, has packed every move look realistic, and impacts the audience; during some you might shout to hit again or bite your underlip with anger.
Verdict - Very close attempt to forefront the historical win of Indian Army, who tried to shake it's confidence - and the fitting answer, the child's war cry on her Dad's funeral will rip you apart. This movie uplifts the pride of Indian Army, and you being Proud of having them by your side. So 'Howz the Josh' My Review Rating - 3.75 / 5.0
